abstract.p:
SPLAT is a graphical tool for displaying, comparing, modifying and analysing astronomical spectra stored in NDF, FITS and TEXT files as well as the new NDX format. It can read in many spectra at the same time and then display these as line plots. Each display window, of which there can be many, can be used to view one or several spectra at the same time. Display windows can be interactively zoomed and scrolled, centred on specific wavelengths, provide continuous coordinate readout, annotated, produce printable hardcopy and be configured in many ways. They also provide the basis for interactive analysis facilities. All of these functions are displayed in a visually rich format, that is intended to appeal especially to casual users of spectral data analysis facilities, as it includes some facilities such as drag-and-drop and undo-able editing.
The current set of analysis facilities include background estimation line fitting, filtering, and de-noising. A database of laboratory line positions is available to aid in identification.
SPLAT also supports a full range of coordinate systems for spectra, using the latest facilities of the Starlink AST library.
